Laying on his bedsheet clad in only a pair of loose plaid boxers, Nick reached and grabbed his phone that was charging on his nightstand.

"Saturday, June 2nd 11:32am," the screen read.

That was probably the only advantage of working at Williams & Williams: Nick was gauranteed to have Saturdays and Sundays off. Every weekday, however, filled with same stale tasks: Load the trucks, unload the truck trucks, move these boxes, get yelled at by that boss. When Nick thought about it, perhaps the lack of drug testing was another perk to the job. Nobody seemed to mind when he would come into work a little bit stoned.

Putting the phone back down, Nick turned on the bedsides lamp, illuminating his messy room. Dirty clothes lay in a pile in a corner, various junk food bags were scattered around, several skateboards in varying forms of construction and deconstruction were on the side of the room, his dressers were a mess, and sitting on top of them were a couple of bongs and marijuana paraphernalia.

Nothing was on the docket for Nick today. Drumming his fingers on his bare, hairless abdomen, he thought about how to spend his Saturday.

From the other side of the wall opposite to him, Nick heard someone moving around and surmised that his roommate Diego must be up. Diego might have the day off too, Nick thought, and he could spend the day chilling out with him.

But it was supposed to be a bright and warm Summer day, so he could take advantage of the good weather and hit up some of his favorite skating spots.

Perhaps he should pull himself out of bed and grab something to eat. Nick has never had much of an appetite, so he'd have to get a little high if he wanted to keep something down.

...or just get high and go right back to bed. The past couple of weeks at work had been pretty rough. Maybe spending a little more time sleeping would do his body good.
